      • show

        public void show(android.app.Activity activity,
        int x,
        int y,
        int gravity)
        Show this button at the specific location. If this button isn't attached to any parent view yet, it will be add to activity's root view. If not, it will just update the location.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that this button will be attached to.
        x - The x value of anchor point.
        y - The y value of anchor point.
        gravity - The gravity apply with this button.
        See Also:
        Gravity

      • show

        public void show(android.view.ViewGroup parent,
        int x,
        int y,
        int gravity)
        Show this button at the specific location. If this button isn't attached to any parent view yet, it will be add to activity's root view. If not, it will just update the location.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent view. Should be FrameLayout or RelativeLayout
        x - The x value of anchor point.
        y - The y value of anchor point.
        gravity - The gravity apply with this button.
        See Also:
        Gravity

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation(int x,
                  int y,
                  int gravity)
        Update the location of this button. This method only work if it's already attached to a parent view.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of anchor point.
        y - The y value of anchor point.
        gravity - The gravity apply with this button.
        See Also:
        Gravity
